title: 1988 PGA Championship
text:
The 1988 PGA Championship was the 70th <a href="PGA%20Championship">PGA Championship</a>, held August 11–14 at <a href="Oak%20Tree%20Golf%20Club">Oak Tree Golf Club</a> in <a href="Edmond%2C%20Oklahoma">Edmond, Oklahoma</a>, a suburb north of <a href="Oklahoma%20City">Oklahoma City</a>. <a href="Jeff%20Sluman">Jeff Sluman</a> shot a final round 65 (−6) to win his only <a href="Men%27s%20major%20golf%20championships">major</a> title, three strokes ahead of runner-up <a href="Paul%20Azinger">Paul Azinger</a>, the 36-hole and 54-hole leader and former college teammate. Azinger was the reigning Player of the Year on the <a href="PGA%20Tour">PGA Tour</a>.
In the penultimate pairing on Sunday, Sluman was three strokes back at the start of the round. After a birdie at the second, he holed out for an eagle on the par-5 fifth, and when Azinger followed with a bogey, the two were tied at nine-under. Sluman had five birdies and an eagle with just one bogey in the final round while Azinger posted a second straight even-par 71. It was also the first of Sluman's six victories on the PGA Tour. In the final pair with Azinger, <a href="Dave%20Rummells">Dave Rummells</a> shot 75 (+4) and fell to a tie for sixth.
Azinger won the title five years later, defeating <a href="Greg%20Norman">Greg Norman</a> in a playoff in <a href="1993%20PGA%20Championship">1993</a>.
